block.p: Kiera Amy Scharfenberger, the daughter of Joan M. Reilly of Centerport, N.Y., and Joseph M. Scharfenberger Sr. of Lloyd Harbor, N.Y., was married Friday to Ryan Matthew Branon, a son of Sarah T. Branon and Dr. Mark E. Branon Jr. of Princeton, N.J. The Rev. Harold Ridley, the president of Loyola College of Maryland in Baltimore, performed the ceremony at the Loyola College Chapel.
The bride and the bridegroom graduated from Loyola of Maryland, from which the bride also received a master's degree in education administration.

Kiera Amy Scharfenberger, the daughter of Joan M. Reilly of Centerport, N.Y., and Joseph M. Scharfenberger Sr. of Lloyd Harbor, N.Y., was married Friday to Ryan Matthew Branon, a son of Sarah T. Branon and Dr. Mark E. Branon Jr. of Princeton, N.J. The Rev. Harold Ridley, the president of Loyola College of Maryland in Baltimore, performed the ceremony at the Loyola College Chapel.
The bride and the bridegroom graduated from Loyola of Maryland, from which the bride also received a master's degree in education administration.

Mrs. Branon, 26, teaches the second grade at St. Pius X School in Baltimore. Her father is the executive vice president for small business services at the Chase Manhattan Bank in New York. Her mother is a branch manager for Prudential Securities in New York.

Mr. Branon, 27, is an account executive at Advance Business Systems, an office equipment distributor in Baltimore. His mother teaches the sixth grade at Stuart Country Day School of the Sacred Heart in Princeton. His father, who is retired, was a founding partner in Princeton Gastroenterology Associates.
